title: Pep Guardiola fears Oleksandr Zinchenko could be out until December
text:
Pep Guardiola fears Oleksandr Zinchenko could be missing until December after undergoing knee surgery – while Rodri is likely to miss Manchester City’s crunch clash against Liverpool.

Zinchenko suffered the injury on international duty with Ukraine and travelled to Barcelona for treatment under Dr Ramon Cugat.

The 22-year-old is believed to have had keyhole surgery, which will see him absent for next month’s clash against Chelsea as well as Liverpool on November 10.

Pep Guardiola is concerned defender Oleksandr Zinchenko could be out until December

Zinchenko has undergone knee surgery to add to Manchester City's defensive crisis

Rodri limped off against Atalanta in midweek, and is also likely to miss City's Liverpool game

Rodri limped out of Tuesday night’s 5-1 demolition of Atalanta in the Champions League with a hamstring problem.

‘It's not a big issue but he'll be out for five or six weeks,’ Guardiola said. ‘They did something to clean the knee, it’s not a big thing. He had a contact with a knee and felt something in the bone.

‘They told me that after the international break maybe Rodri will be ready again.’

Guardiola has Benjamin Mendy, Angelino and Joao Cancelo to call on in Zinchenko’s absence, but it is yet another injury blow for the Premier League champions.

Zinchenko 'felt something in his bone' and will be out for 'five to six weeks' said Guardiola

City are also nursing John Stones back to full fitness following a thigh injury and Guardiola maintained the central defender is still working his way back.

‘It’s not about being first choice, it’s about being fit,’ the City boss added. ‘He’s had a long, long time with many injuries. Vinny (Kompany) and (Aymeric) Laporte were in incredible top form last season. This season (John is) injured and injured and injured sometimes it needs more time.’

Rodri’s injury may open the door for Phil Foden, who made his second start of the season in midweek.

City are also nursing John Stones back to full health following the defender's thigh injury

Foden glistened in midfield before seeing red for two bookings. Ilkay Gundogan is likely to fill in for Rodri, which should give the academy graduate more opportunities.

‘Every season he will be better. It is about time,’ Guardiola said. ‘When he’s 23 he’ll be better than now and 26 better than 23.

‘He’s an incredible worker, he’s a fighter. The rest of the guys in the Under 23 side say the same - they all say they should play more and they are right. But it is what it is.’
description: Pep Guardiola fears Oleksandr Zinchenko could be missing until December after undergoing knee surgery - while Rodri is likely to miss Manchester City's crunch clash against Liverpool.
